1
1       You are standing at the end of a road before a small brick building.
1       Around you is a forest.  A small stream flows out of the building and
1       down a gully.
2       You have walked up a hill, still in the forest.  The road slopes back
2       down the other side of the hill.  There is a building in the distance.
3       You are inside a building, a well house for a large spring.  Off
3       to one side is a small storeroom.
4       You are in a valley in the forest beside a stream tumbling along a
4       rocky bed.
5       You are in open forest, with a deep valley to one side.  Not far
5       off is a large billboard.
6       You are in open forest near both a valley and a road.
7       At your feet all the water of the stream splashes into a 2-inch slit
7       in the rock.  Downstream the streambed is bare rock.
8       You are in a 20-foot depression floored with bare dirt.  Set into the
8       dirt is a strong steel grate mounted in concrete.  A dry streambed
8       leads into the depression.
9       You are in a small chamber beneath a 3x3 steel grate to the surface.
9       A low crawl over cobbles leads inward to the west.
10      You are crawling over cobbles in a low passage.  There is a dim light
10      at the east end of the passage.
11      You are in a debris room filled with stuff washed in from the surface.
11      A low wide passage with cobbles becomes plugged with mud and debris
11      here, but an awkward canyon leads upward and west.  A note on the wall
11      says "Magic Word XYZZY".
12      You are in an awkward sloping east/west canyon.
13      You are in a splendid chamber thirty feet high.  The walls are frozen
13      rivers of orange stone.  An awkward canyon and a good passage exit
13      from east and west sides of the chamber.
14      At your feet is a small pit breathing traces of white mist.  An east
14      passage ends here except for a small crack leading on.
15      You are at one end of a vast hall stretching forward out of sight to
15      the west.  There are openings to either side.  Nearby, a wide stone
15      staircase leads downward.  The hall is filled with wisps of white mist
15      swaying to and fro almost as if alive.  A cold wind blows up the
15      staircase.  There is a passage at the top of a dome behind you.
16      The crack is far too small for you to follow.
17      You are on the east bank of a fissure slicing clear across the hall.
17      The mist is quite thick here, and the fissure is too wide to jump.
18      This is a low room with a crude note on the wall.  The note says,
18      "You won't get it up the steps".
19      You are in the Hall of the Mountain King, with passages off in all
19      directions.
20      You are at the bottom of the pit with a broken neck.
21      You didn't make it.
22      The dome is unclimbable.
23      You are at the west end of the Twopit Room.  There is a large hole in
23      the wall above the pit at this end of the room.
24      You are at the bottom of the eastern pit in the Twopit Room.  There is
24      a small pool of oil in one corner of the pit.
25      You are at the bottom of the western pit in the Twopit Room.  There is
25      a large hole in the wall about 25 feet above you.
26      You clamber up the plant and scurry through the hole at the top.
27      You are on the west side of the fissure in the Hall of Mists.
28      You are in a low N/S passage at a hole in the floor.  The hole goes
28      down to an E/W passage.
29      You are in the South Side Chamber.
30      You are in the West Side Chamber of the Hall of the Mountain King.
30      A passage continues west and up here.
31      >$<
32      You can't get by the snake.
33      You are in a large room, with a passage to the south, a passage to the
33      west, and a wall of broken rock to the east.  There is a large "Y2" on
33      a rock in the room's center.
34      You are in a jumble of rock, with cracks everywhere.
35      You're at a low window overlooking a huge pit, which extends up out of
35      sight.  A floor is indistinctly visible over 50 feet below.  Traces of
35      white mist cover the floor of the pit, becoming thicker to the right.
35      Marks in the dust around the window would seem to indicate that
35      someone has been here recently.  Directly across the pit from you and
35      25 feet away there is a similar window looking into a lighted room.  A
35      shadowy figure can be seen there peering back at you.
36      You are in a dirty broken passage.  To the east is a crawl.  To the
36      west is a large passage.  Above you is a hole to another passage.
37      You are on the brink of a small clean climbable pit.  A crawl leads
37      west.
38      You are in the bottom of a small pit with a little stream, which
38      enters and exits through tiny slits.
39      You are in a large room full of dusty rocks.  There is a big hole in
39      the floor.  There are cracks everywhere, and a passage leading east.
40      You have crawled through a very low wide passage parallel to and north
40      of the Hall of Mists.
41      You are at the west end of Hall of Mists.  A low wide crawl continues
41      west and another goes north.  To the south is a little passage 6 feet
41      off the floor.
42      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
43      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
44      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
45      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
46      Dead end.
47      Dead end.
48      Dead end.
49      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
50      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
51      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
52      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
53      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
54      Dead end.
55      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
56      Dead end.
57      You are on the brink of a thirty foot pit with a massive orange column
57      down one wall.  You could climb down here but you could not get back
57      up.  The maze continues at this level.
58      Dead end.
59      You have crawled through a very low wide passage parallel to and north
59      of the Hall of Mists.
60      You are at the east end of a very long hall apparently without side
60      chambers.  In the south wall are several wide cracks and a high
60      hole, but the hole is far above your head.  To the east a wide
60      crawl slants up.  To the north a round two foot hole slants down.
61      You are at the west end of a very long featureless hall.  The hall
61      joins up with a narrow north/south passage.
62      You are at a crossover of a high N/S passage and a low E/W one.
63      Dead end.
64      You are at a complex junction.  A low hands and knees passage from the
64      north joins a higher crawl from the east to make a walking passage
64      going west.  There is also a large room above.  The air is damp here.
65      You are in Bedquilt, a long east/west passage with holes everywhere.
65      To explore at random select north, south, up, or down.
66      You are in a room whose walls resemble swiss cheese.  Obvious passages
66      go west, east, NE, and NW.  Part of the room is occupied by a large
66      bedrock block.
67      You are at the east end of the Twopit Room.  The floor here is
67      littered with thin rock slabs, which make it easy to descend the pits.
67      There is a path here bypassing the pits to connect passages from east
67      and west.  There are holes all over, but the only big one is on the
67      wall directly over the west pit where you can't get to it.
68      You are in a large low circular chamber whose floor is an immense slab
68      fallen from the ceiling (Slab Room).  East and west there once were
68      large passages, but they are now filled with boulders.  Low small
68      passages go north and south, and the south one quickly bends west
68      around the boulders.
69      You are in a secret N/S canyon above a large room.
70      You are in a secret N/S canyon above a sizable passage.
71      You are in a secret canyon at a junction of three canyons, bearing
71      north, south, and SE.  The north one is as tall as the other two
71      combined.
72      You are in a large low room.  Crawls lead north, NE, and SW.
73      Dead end crawl.
74      You are in a secret canyon which here runs E/W.  It crosses over a
74      very tight canyon 15 feet below.  If you go down you may not be able
74      to get back up.
75      You are at a wide place in a very tight N/S canyon.
76      The canyon here becomes too tight to go further south.
77      You are in a tall E/W canyon.  A low tight crawl goes 3 feet north and
77      seems to open up.
78      The canyon runs into a mass of boulders -- dead end.
79      The stream flows out through a pair of 1 foot diameter sewer pipes.
79      It would be advisable to use the exit.
80      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
81      Dead end.
82      Dead end.
83      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
84      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
85      Dead end.
86      Dead end.
87      You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.
88      You are in a long, narrow corridor stretching out of sight to the
88      west.  At the eastern end is a hole through which you can see a
88      profusion of leaves.
89      There is nothing here to climb.  Use "up" or "out" to leave the pit.
90      You have climbed up the plant and out of the pit.
91      You are at the top of a steep incline above a large room.  You could
91      climb down here, but you would not be able to climb up.  There is a
91      passage leading back to the north.
92      You are in the Giant Room.  The ceiling here is too high up for your
92      lamp to show it.  Cavernous passages lead east, north, and south.  On
92      the west wall is scrawled the inscription, "FEE FIE FOE FOO" [sic].
93      The passage here is blocked by a recent cave-in.
94      You are at one end of an immense north/south passage.
95      You are in a magnificent cavern with a rushing stream, which cascades
95      over a sparkling waterfall into a roaring whirlpool which disappears
95      through a hole in the floor.  Passages exit to the south and west.
96      You are in the Soft Room.  The walls are covered with heavy curtains,
96      the floor with a thick pile carpet.  Moss covers the ceiling.
97      This is the Oriental Room.  Ancient oriental cave drawings cover the
97      walls.  A gently sloping passage leads upward to the north, another
97      passage leads SE, and a hands and knees crawl leads east.
98      You are following a wide path around the outer edge of a large cavern.
98      Far below, through a heavy white mist, strange splashing noises can be
98      heard.  The mist rises up through a fissure in the ceiling.  The path
98      hugs the cavern's rim to the NE and south, while another branch forks
98      west.  A round chute with extremely smooth walls angles sharply up
98      to the southwest.
99      You are in an alcove.  A small NW path seems to widen after a short
99      distance.  An extremely tight tunnel leads east.  It looks like a very
99      tight squeeze.  An eerie light can be seen at the other end.
100     You're in a small chamber lit by an eerie green light.  An extremely
100     narrow tunnel exits to the west, and a dark corridor leads NE.
101     You're in the Dark-Room.  A corridor leading south is the only exit.
102     You are in an arched hall.  A coral passage once continued up and east
102     from here, but is now blocked by debris.  The air smells of sea water.
103     You're in a large room carved out of sedimentary rock.  The floor and
103     walls are littered with bits of shells imbedded in the stone.  A
103     shallow passage proceeds downward, and a somewhat steeper one leads
103     up.  A low hands and knees passage enters from the south.
104     You are in a long sloping corridor with ragged sharp walls.
105     You are in a cul-de-sac about eight feet across.
106     You are in an anteroom leading to a large passage to the east.  Small
106     passages go west and up.  The remnants of recent digging are evident.
106     A sign in midair here says "Cave under construction beyond this point.
106     Proceed at own risk.  [Witt Construction Company]".
107     You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all different.
108     You are at Witt's End.  Passages lead off in *ALL* directions.
109     You are in a north/south canyon about 25 feet across.  The floor is
109     covered by white mist seeping in from the north.  The walls extend
109     upward for well over 100 feet.  Suspended from some unseen point far
109     above you, an enormous two-sided mirror is hanging parallel to and
109     midway between the canyon walls.  (The mirror is obviously provided
109     for the use of the dwarves, who as you know, are extremely vain.)  A
109     small window can be seen in either wall, some fifty feet up.
110     You're at a low window overlooking a huge pit, which extends up out of
110     sight.  A floor is indistinctly visible over 50 feet below.  Traces of
110     white mist cover the floor of the pit, becoming thicker to the left.
110     Marks in the dust around the window would seem to indicate that
110     someone has been here recently.  Directly across the pit from you and
110     25 feet away there is a similar window looking into a lighted room.  A
110     shadowy figure can be seen there peering back at you.
111     A large stalactite extends from the roof and almost reaches the floor
111     below.  You could climb down it, and jump from it to the floor, but
111     having done so you would be unable to reach it to climb back up.
112     You are in a little maze of twisting passages, all different.
113     You are at the edge of a large underground reservoir.  An opaque cloud
113     of white mist fills the room and rises rapidly upward.  The lake is
113     fed by a stream, which tumbles out of a hole in the wall about 10 feet
113     overhead and splashes noisily into the water somewhere within the
113     mist.  The indistinct shape of the opposite shore can be dimly seen
113     through the mist.  The only passage goes back toward the south.
114     Dead end.
115     You are at the northeast end of an immense room, even larger than the
115     Giant Room.  It appears to be a repository for the "ADVENTURE"
115     program.  Massive torches far overhead bathe the room with smokey
115     yellow light.  Scattered about you can be seen a pile of bottles (all
115     of them empty), a nursery of young beanstalks murmuring quietly, a bed
115     of oysters, a bundle of black rods with rusty stars on their ends, and
115     a collection of brass lanterns.  Off to one side a great many dwarves
115     are sleeping on the floor, snoring loudly.  A sign nearby reads: "Do
115     not disturb the dwarves!"  An immense mirror is hanging against one
115     wall, and stretches to the other end of the room, where various other
115     sundry objects can be glimpsed dimly in the distance.  An unoccupied
115     telephone booth stands against the north wall.
116     You are at the southwest end of the repository.  To one side is a pit
116     full of fierce green snakes.  On the other side is a row of small
116     wicker cages, each of which contains a little sulking bird.  In one
116     corner is a bundle of black rods with rusty marks on their ends.  A
116     large number of velvet pillows are scattered about on the floor.
116     Beside one of the pillows is a large, dusty, leather-bound volume
116     with the title "History of Adventure" embossed in pure gold.  A
116     vast mirror stretches off to the northeast, almost reaching the
116     phone booth.  At your feet is a large steel grate, next to which is
116     a sign which reads, "Treasure Vault. Keys in Main Office."
117     You are on one side of a large, deep chasm.  A heavy white mist rising
117     up from below obscures all view of the far side.  A SW path leads away
117     from the chasm into a winding corridor.
118     You are in a long winding corridor sloping out of sight in both
118     directions.
119     You are in a secret canyon which exits to the north and east.
120     You are in a secret canyon which exits to the north and east.
121     You are in a secret canyon which exits to the north and east.
122     You are on the northeast side of a deep chasm.  A NE path leads
122     away from the chasm on this side.  A very narrow path hugging
122     the rim of the chasm falls off almost vertically to the west.
123     You're in a long east/west corridor.  A faint rumbling noise can be
123     heard in the distance.
124     The path forks here.  The left fork leads northeast.  A dull rumbling
124     seems to get louder in that direction.  The right fork leads southeast
124     down a gentle slope.  The main corridor enters from the west.
125     The walls are quite warm here.  From the north can be heard a steady
125     roar, so loud that the entire cave seems to be trembling.  Another
125     passage leads south, and a low crawl goes east.
126     You are on the edge of a breath-taking view.  Far below you is an
126     active volcano, from which great gouts of molten lava come surging
126     out, cascading back down into the depths.  The glowing rock fills the
126     farthest reaches of the cavern with a blood-red glare, giving every-
126     thing an eerie, macabre appearance.  The air is filled with flickering
126     sparks of ash and a heavy smell of brimstone.  The walls are hot to
126     the touch, and the thundering of the volcano drowns out all other
126     sounds.  Embedded in the jagged roof far overhead are myriad twisted
126     formations composed of pure white alabaster, which scatter the murky
126     light into sinister apparitions upon the walls.  To one side is a deep
126     gorge, filled with a bizarre chaos of tortured rock which seems to
126     have been crafted by the devil himself.  An immense river of fire
126     crashes out from the depths of the volcano, burns its way through the
126     gorge, and plummets into a bottomless pit far off to your left.  To
126     the right, an immense geyser of blistering steam erupts continuously
126     from a barren island in the center of a sulfurous lake, which bubbles
126     ominously.  The far right wall is aflame with an incandescence of its
126     own, which lends an additional infernal splendor to the already
126     hellish scene.  A dark, foreboding passage exits to the south.
127     You are in a small chamber filled with large boulders.  The walls are
127     very warm, causing the air in the room to be almost stifling from the
127     heat.  The only exit is a crawl heading west, through which is coming
127     a low rumbling.
128     You are walking along a gently sloping north/south passage lined with
128     oddly shaped limestone formations.
129     You are standing at the entrance to a large, barren room.  A sign
129     posted above the entrance reads:  "Caution!  Bear in room!"
130     You are inside a barren room.  The center of the room is completely
130     empty except for some dust.  Marks in the dust lead away toward the
130     far end of the room.  The only exit is the way you came in.
131     You are in a maze of twisting little passages, all different.
132     You are in a little maze of twisty passages, all different.

139     You are in a maze of little twisty passages, all different.
140     Dead end.
141     You are on a narrow promontory at the foot of a waterfall, which
141     spurts from an overhead hole in the rock wall and splashes into a
141     large reservoir, sending up clouds of mist and spray.
141     There is a narrow chimney on the east side of the promontory.
141     Through the thick white mist looms a polished marble slab, to
141     which is affixed an enormous rusty iron anvil.  In golden letters
141     are written the words: "Whoso Pulleth Out This Sword of This
141     Stone and Anvil, is Rightwise King-Born of All This Mountain."
142     You are on a narrow shelf above and east of the top of a very steep
142     chimney.  A long smooth granite slide curves down out of sight
142     to the east.  If you go down the slide, you may not be able to
142     climb back up.
143     You are in the private chamber of the Mountain King.  Hewn into the
143     solid rock of the east wall of the chamber is an intricately-wrought
143     throne of elven design.  There is an exit to the west.
144     You are on the east side of the throne room.  On the arm of the throne
144     has been hung a sign which reads "Gone for the day: visiting
144     sick snake. --M.K."
145     You are dragged down, down, into the depths of the whirlpool.
145     Just as you can no longer hold your breath, you are shot out over
145     a waterfall into the shallow end of a large reservoir.  Gasping
145     and sputtering, you crawl weakly towards the shore....
146     You are in dense forest, with a hill to one side.  The trees appear
146     to thin out towards the north and east.
147     You are at the high point of a wide grassy knoll, partially surrounded
147     by dense forest.  The land rises to the south and east, and drops off
147     sharply to the north and west.  The air smells of sea water.
148     You are at the edge of a trackless salt marsh.  Tall reeds obscure
148     the view.  In the mud is the partial word "-RO--O".  The missing
148     letters have been washed away by the tide.
149     You're in salt marsh.
150     You're in salty marsh.
151     You are in salt marsh.
152     Dead end.
153     You're on a sandy beach at the edge of the open sea.  The beach
153     stretches out of sight to the south.  To the north, the beach ends
153     in cliffs and blackened shoals.
154     You are at a jumble of large broken rocks and blackened shoals.
154     A gentle path leads up to the top of the nearby cliffs.  A narrow
154     treacherous path disappears among the rocks at the foot of the cliff.
155     You are on a high cliff overlooking the sea.  Far below the
155     rolling breakers smash into a jumble of blackened shoals.
155     The thunder of the surf is deafening.
156     You're at the bottom of the cliff, smashed to a lifeless pulp by the
156     pounding surf.
157     You are at Thunder Hole, a funnel shaped cavern opening onto the sea.
157     The noise of the surf pounding against the outer rocks of the cave is
157     amplified by the peculiar shape of the cave, causing a thunder-like
157     booming sound to reverberate throughout the cave.  Outside, a narrow
157     path leads south towards some large rocks.
158     You are at the top of some arched steps.  On one side is a blank wall
158     with a tiny door at the base and a shelf overhead.  On the other side
158     a westward passage leads to the sea.
159     You are in a low cramped chamber at the back of a small cave.
159     There is a shelf in the rock wall at about the height of your
159     shoulder.
160     You are on a wide ledge, bounded on one side by a rock wall,
160     and on the other by a sheer cliff.  The only way past is through
160     a large wrought-iron door.
161     You feel dizzy...Everything around you is spinning, expanding,
161     growing larger....  Dear me!  Is the cave bigger or are you smaller?
162     You are again overcome by a sickening vertigo, but this time
162     everything around you is shrinking...Shrinking...
163     You are again overcome by a sickening vertigo, but this time
163     everything is shrinking... I mean, you are growing.  This is
163     terribly confusing!
164     You feel dizzy...Everything around you is spinning, expanding,
164     growing larger....
165     You're at the bottom of the cliff with a broken neck.
166     You are at the western tip of the Blue Grotto.  A large lake almost
166     covers the cavern floor, except for where you are standing.  Small
166     holes high in the rock wall to the east admit a dim light.  The
166     reflection of the light from the water suffuses the cavern with
166     a hazy bluish glow.
167     You are on the western shore of an underground sea.  The way
167     west is through a wrought-iron door.
168     You are on the eastern shore of the Blue Grotto.  An ascending
168     tunnel disappears into the darkness to the SE.
169     You are at a high rock on the NE side of a watery chamber at the mouth
169     of a small brook.  An unknown gas bubbles up through the water from
169     the chamber floor.  A bluish light can be seen to the southwest.
170     You are in a windy tunnel between two large rooms.
171     You are in the Bat Cave.  The ceiling and tops of the walls are
171     covered with sleeping bats.  The floor is buried by a mass of dry,
171     foul-smelling guano.  The stench is overpowering.  Exits to the NW
171     and east.
172     You are in a very tight N/S crack.  The passage seems to widen to
172     the south.
173     You are in a very tight N/S crack.  The passage south is blocked
173     by a recent cave-in.
174     You're in the Cloakroom.  This is where the dreaded Wumpus repairs
174     to sleep off heavy meals.  (Adventurers are his favorite dinner!)
174     Two very narrow passages exit NW and NE.
175     You're in a room containing several small climbable pits.  Passages
175     exit to the east and north.
176     You are at the bottom of a small featureless pit.
177     You are at a high hole in a rock wall.
178     The NE passage is blocked by a recent cave-in.
179     You are in a sloping muddy defile, next to a tumbling brook.
180     You are in a level E/W passage partially blocked by an overhanging
180     tongue of rock.  A steep scramble would take you up over the tongue,
180     whence continues an upward crawl.  There is a small hole in the
180     north wall of the passage.
181     The dog won't let you pass.
182     You're in the Upper Passage, a long level E/W tunnel.
183     You are in a star-shaped chamber.  Passages exit north, east, south,
183     and west.
184     You are at an elbow in a winding E/W passage.
185     Dead end.
186     You're at the intersection of two long tunnels.  One goes NW,
186     the other NE.
187     You're in a long narrow east-west passage which curves out of sight
187     at both ends.
188     You're in the Rotunda.  Corridors radiate in all directions.
188     There is a telephone booth standing against the north wall.
189     You are standing in a telephone booth at the side of a large chamber.
189     Hung on the wall is a banged-up pay telephone of ancient design.
190     You're at the Devil's Chair, a large crystallization shaped like a
190     seat, at the edge of a black abyss.  You can't see the bottom.
190     An upward path leads away from the abyss.
191     You're in a dead-end crack.
192     You're on a small gravel beach at the south wall of the Blue Grotto.
192     A gravelly path leads east.
193     You are in the Apiary.  The walls are covered with colorful,
193     intricate, flower-like patterns of crystallized gypsum.
194     You are at the end of a short E/W corridor.
195     You are looking west from the end of a short E/W corridor.  At your
195     feet is a pile of loose rubble.  On your left is a hole into another
195     chamber.
196     You are in an arched hall.  The remnants of a now-plugged coral
196     passage lie to the east.  The north wall has partially crumbled,
196     exposing a large connecting hole to another room.
197     You're in the Vestibule, a short passageway between two rooms.
198     You are in the Fairy Grotto.  All around you innumerable stalactites,
198     arranged in immense colonnades, form elegant arches.  On every side
198     you hear the dripping of water, like the footsteps of a thousand
198     fairies.  A small stream runs from the SW corner.  A bright glow
198     emanates from the south side of the grotto, and a steep passage
198     descends to the east.
199     You have approached the lower end of a steep passage, but it is
199     just too cold here to hang around, and you aren't properly equipped
199     to continue.  With teeth chattering, you climb back up....
200     You are in the Crystal Palace.  An overhead vein of phosphorescent
200     quartz casts a luminous glow which is reflected by countless chips of
200     mica embedded in both walls, which consist of some sort of highly
200     reflective glass, apparently of volcanic origin.  A winding path
200     of yellow sandstone leads west and rises steeply to the east.
201     You are following a yellow sandstone path.  There is a glow
201     to the west.
202     You are in a very tall chamber whose walls are comprised of many
202     different rock strata.  Layers of red and yellow sandstone
202     intertwine with bright bands of calcareous limestone in a rainbow-
202     like profusion of color.  The rainbow effect is so real, you
202     are almost tempted to look for a pot of gold!  Poised far over
202     your head, a gigantic slab, wedged tightly between the north and
202     south walls, forms a natural bridge across the roof of the chamber.
203     You're in a steeply sloping passage.  It is very cold here.
204     You are in the Hall of Ice, in the deepest part of the caverns.
204     During winter, frigid outside air settles here, making this room
204     extremely cold all year round.  The walls and ceilings are covered
204     with a thick coating of ice.  An upward passage exits to the west.
205     You are standing on a natural bridge far above the floor of a circular
205     chamber whose walls are a rainbow of multi-colored rock.  The bridge
205     was formed eons ago by a huge slab which fell from the ceiling and
205     is now jammed between the north and south walls of the chamber.
206     You are in a low, wide room below another chamber.  A small green
206     pond fills the center of the room.  The lake is apparently spring-
206     fed.  There is a narrow passage to the north.
206     A larger passage continues west.
207     You are in a tight north/south crawl through a stratum of red
207     colored rock.  The air is damp with mist.
208     You are in a tall canyon on the south side of a swift, wide river.
208     Written in the mud in crude letters are the words: "You Have Found
208     Lost River."  A wide path leads west along the bank.  A tight
208     crawlway would take you out of the canyon.
209     You are standing on a large flat rock table at the western end of
209     Lost River Canyon.  Beneath your feet, the river disappears amidst
209     foam and spray into a large sinkhole.  A gentle path leads east
209     along the river's south shore.  Another leads sharply upward along
209     the river's north side.
210     You are at a niche in the canyon wall, far above a raging river.
210     The air is filled with mist and spray, making it difficult to see
210     ahead.  An E/W sloping ledge hugging the canyon's rim narrows to
210     the east.  A wide crack in the canyon wall leads north and
210     quickly bends around to the left.
211     You are on a narrow and treacherous ledge, which rises
211     almost vertically to the east.
212     You are standing in a telephone booth at the side of the Repository.
213     You're at the east end of a level passage at a hole in the floor.
214     You're at the north edge of a dark cove.
215     You are in a dry granite basin, worn smooth eons ago by water
215     swirling down from a now-dry spillway.
216     You're in a dry spillway east of and above a smooth rock basin.
217     You are in the Winery, a cool dark room which extends some
217     distance off to the east.
218     You are to the east of the Winery, where the room ends in a thicket
218     of high, sharp, pointed, climbable limestone pinnacles.  There is a
218     narrow ledge just above the top of the spires.  If you go up, it
218     might be difficult to get back down.
219     You are in a high-vaulted cavern whose roof rises over fifty
219     meters to culminate in a series of pointed arches directly over
219     your head.  There are also two low arches to either side, forming
219     side portals.  The whole effect is that of a gothic cathedral.
220     You're at the east portal of the Gothic Cathedral.
221     You're at the west portal of the Gothic Cathedral.
222     You are at the foot of the Altar, an immense, broad stalagmite.
223     You're on top of an enormous, broad stalagmite.  There is a hole
223     in the ceiling overhead.
224     You are in a room the size and shape of a small crypt.  A narrow
224     cut exits east.  There is a hole in the floor.
225     You are in the Gothic Chapel, a small chamber adjoining the Gothic
225     Cathedral.
226     You are on the floor of the Rainbow Room.  In fact, you are spread
226     *ALL OVER* the floor of the Rainbow Room.
227     You are in a dimly lit passage behind Thunder Hole.  Etched into
227     the rock wall are the ominous words:
227     >$<
227             You are approaching the River Styx.
227             Lasciate Ogni Speranza Voi Ch'Entrate.
227     >$<
228     You are at the River Styx, a narrow little stream cutting directly
228     across the passageway.  The edge of the stream is littered with sticks
228     and other debris washed in by a recent rainfall.  On the far side
228     of the river, the passage continues east.
229     You're on the east side of the river's sticks.
230     You are on a ledge at the northern end of a long N/S crawl.  The
230     ledge is above a large number of sharp vertical limestone spires.
230     An attempt to climb down could be dangerous, if you get my *point*!
231     You are very neatly skewered on the point of a sharp rock.
232     You have poled your boat across the calm water.
233     You have poled your boat across the dark water.
234     You have poled your boat across the Blue Grotto.
235     You're at Dante's Rest, on the north side of a yawning dark chasm.
235     A passage continues west along the chasm's edge.
236     You are at the east end of a riverbank path in Lost River Canyon.
237     The staircase is now unclimbable.
238     You're in the caretaker's storeroom.
239     You are in many small pieces at the bottom of a deep chasm.
240     You are standing behind a large billboard on a ridge above a deep
240     valley.  To the north, the forest gives way to dense swamp and
240     then to open flatlands.  Far beyond, the land rises sharply towards
240     the impassible Misty Mountains.  Nestled at the base of a distant
240     cliff are the stone turrets of a tall white castle.
241     You are in hilly forest, but northward the land flattens out
241     and grows swampy.  To the south and east is a heavily wooded
241     ridge of low hills.
242     You're at the edge of a great forest.  To the north lies dark,
242     ominous swampland.
243     Dense swamp surrounds you.  Dim sunlight filters through the
243     foliage; all directions look alike.
244     You are in a dark, murky swamp.  However, the deep foliage
244     appears to thin out towards the south and southwest.  There
244     is a faint smell of brackish salt water in the air.
245     You are at the edge of an open area of wet sand.  The dense
245     foliage appears to grow thinner towards the northeast.  A small
245     sign stuck in the muck reads: "Site of Proposed Municipal Parking
245     Lot -- D.M. Witt, Contractor."
246     You've wandered into a quicksand pit and drowned.
247     You are in an open area near the edge of the swamp.  The ground
247     near you appears to have been paved with concrete.
248     You're in an open field on the south side of a deep ravine.  South
248     and west the land is an almost impassible swamp.  To the west the
248     ravine merges with the swamp; some distance to the east it ends
248     abruptly at the foot of a sheer granite cliff.  A dry drainage pipe
248     six inches in diameter emerges from the base of the cliff just
248     above the floor of the ravine.
249     The bramblebush is too thick and thorny to penetrate.
250     You are in a dull N/S passage beside a tall black rock.  On the rock
250     is chisled the outline of a four-leafed clover, under which is the
250     inscription: "Notice: This rock fabricated from ersatz materials."
251     You are beside a deep, water-filled moat, in front of a great stone
251     castle.
252     You are at the foot of a towering cliff.  The sheer rock face is
252     partially obscured by thick vines growing up the cliff.
253     You are on a ledge about halfway up the cliff.  The upper part of
253     the cliff seems unclimbable.
254     You are beside an old dry well in the East Courtyard of a great
254     castle built against the southern face of an unscalable granite
254     cliff.  On your left an impregnable wall of gleaming white stone
254     encompasses the entire court and castle in a half-moon shaped curve
254     which meets the cliff at either end.  To your right, across the
254     steeply rising courtyard, is Lords' Keep, the heart of the castle.
255     You're at the bottom of a dry wellshaft.  Every bone in your
255     body is broken.
256     You are at the bottom of a vertical shaft, apparently a dry well,
256     whose cylindrical wall is lined with smooth stone.  Far above your
256     head, you can see daylight!
257     You are at a sharp bend in a very narrow defile between two sheer
257     rock walls.  The defile curves out of sight to the NW and SW.
258     You are in an open field north of a deep ravine.  The ravine
258     terminates at the base of a towering N/S cliff.  A narrow crack
258     in the base of the cliff leads east.
259     You're in a large chamber.  All around are massive skeletons of
259     long-dead members of the order proboscidea ungulata, who evidently
259     used this room as their final resting place.  Passages exit
259     north and south.
260     You are at the bottom of the ravine with a broken head.
261     You are in a short tunnel north of a large room.
262     You are on top of a flat black rock.
263     You are at the entrance to Lords' Keep.
264     You are at the base of the central portion of the courtyard near
264     what appears to be some sort of large wooden door in the stone wall.
264     Attached to the wall is a heavy winch.
265     You are in the West Courtyard, a wide flat area bounded on the north
265     by a high cliff and on the south and west by the curve of the castle
265     wall.
266     You have no way of crossing the moat.
267     You are at the foot of a great cliff.  The moat and castle
267     wall are built flush up against the side of the cliff.  A
267     portion of the cliff's face is obscured by hanging vines.
268     You are in the lair of Ralph the Giant Centipede.  The air reeks
268     with the stench of rotting bits of flesh.  Giant centipedes, in
268     general, are not partial to visitors.
269     You are inside Lords' Keep, at the south end of the Great Hall.
269     The room is lit by smokey torches hung high overhead.  Several
269     passages lead off to connecting rooms.
270     You are in the Aviary, where in days long gone the Royal
270     Falconer kept and trained the King's hunting hawks.
271     The short hallway ends at a heavy steel door inlaid with enamelled
271     tiles, each of which is a different color.  The tiles, nine in all,
271     are arranged in a 3x3 grid, thusly:
271     >$<
271     I--------------------------------------I
271     I    Red     I   Silver   I  Fuschia   I
271     I------------I------------I------------I
271     I    Gold    I    Dun     I   White    I
271     I------------I------------I------------I
271     I   Orange   I   Nacre    I   Black    I
271     I--------------------------------------I
271     >$<
272     You are inside a large steel vault.
273     You are at the foot of a wide ascending staircase at the north
273     end of the Great Hall.  On either side of the staircase, hallways
273     continue north at this level.
274     You are in a long north/south hallway on the west side of the
274     castle.  A short westerly passage leads to an apparent dead end.
275     You are in the Conservatory, whence the gnomes often repair to
275     relax with a little music.  On one side of the room is an old
275     upright piano.
276     You're in a flat circular clearing surrounded by dense forest.
277     You are in a gloomy north/south hallway on the east side of the
277     castle.  An entrance in the west wall leads to a small sunlit room.
278     >$<         (TRANSITION INTO COPTER.)
279     As you move to enter the aircraft, the Orcs block your way.
279     Their leader won't let you board without a letter of transit.
280     After inspecting your letter of transit, the Orcs sullenly stand
280     aside to let you board the aircraft.
281     You are in the helicopter's cramped passenger cabin.  The only
281     visible feature is a silver button on the wall.
282     >$<         (TRANSITION FROM COPTER [1].)
283     >$<         (TRANSITION FROM COPTER [2].)
284     You're on the south end of a high narrow ridge, which is bounded
284     on its east side by a high mountain.  Dug into the mountainside is
284     a ramshackle old mine entrance.  The ridge drops off to the west
284     in a rocky cliff.  You might be able to climb down the cliff, but
284     you probably won't be able to get back up.
285     You are in a gloomy tunnel, the entrance to a long-abandoned mine.
285     All around is fallen rock and rotted timbers.  To your left, a
285     small room adjoins the main tunnel.
286     You are on a narrow N/S ridge high above a stone wall and wide moat.
287     You are at the northwest end of a narrow ridge high above the
287     castle's inner courtyard.
288     You are in an idyllic garden hidden in an inner courtyard of,
288     and surrounded on three sides by, the Castle Keep.  The far end
288     of the garden is bounded by a high cliff.
289     You are in a small room off the east hallway.  Through a heavily
289     barred window you can look out on a lovely secret garden.
290     You have leapt from a great hight into the moat, and drowned.
291     You have jumped from a great hight into a lovely garden which is
291     now your graveyard.
292     After a few seconds in freefall your parachute opens with a sudden
292     "Pop!"  Several moments later you land unhurt.  The magic 'chute
292     then folds itself back into the knapsack.
293     You're in an open field on the south side of a flooded ravine.
293     South and west the land merges into nearly impassible swamp.  In
293     the muck is a fresh footprint!  Incredibly, it looks very
293     much like that of a Giant Devonian Rat, long thought extinct.
294     You are in an open field north of a flooded ravine.  The ravine
294     terminates at the base of a towering N/S cliff.  A narrow crack
294     in the base of the cliff leads east.  A footprint, possibly that of
294     a Giant Devonian Rat, is outlined in the mud.
295     You are at the east end of a steep ravine, near where a drainage
295     pipe emerges from a rock wall.
296     You are at the western end of the ravine's floor.  The ground ahead
296     looks wet and treacherous.
297     You have stumbled into a quicksand patch and drowned.
298     You are in the engineering room.  On a control panel on the wall
298     are four buttons, colored green, brown, red and yellow; and a
298     digital gauge.
299     You are in a very steeply angled tunnel.
300     You are at the bottom of the mine's main shaft.  Several passages,
300     now all blocked by cave-ins, used to lead off in all directions.
300     To the north, the one remaining tunnel is partially blocked.
301     You are in a dead-end shaft formerly used for temporary storage.
302     You are in the Kitchen.  Build into one wall is a narrow floor-to-
302     ceiling cabinet.
303     You are in the midst of a great, grey-green, greasy swamp, all
303     set about with fever trees.
304     You are on a small dry patch of earth, surrounded by dank swamp.

-1
5
1       boulder by well
0000    A large round boulder blocks the path.
1000    There is a large boulder on one side of the tunnel.
2       brass lantern
0000    There is a shiny brass lamp nearby.
1000    There is a lamp shining nearby.
3       grate
0000    The grate is locked.
1000    The grate is open.
4       vines on cliff
0000    >$<       (covering cliff face)
1000    In the center of the cliff, the vines have been parted, revealing
1000    a narrow defile into the rock wall.
5       vines at centipede's lair
0000    >$<
1000    A dim alcove can be seen behind the vines.
6       drawbridge
0000    >$<
1000    A wooden drawbridge spans the moat.
2000    With a great creaking and groaning, the winch raises the drawbridge
2000    to a vertical position against the stone wall.
3000    Turning the winch slowly lowers the great wooden drawbridge.
7       steps
0000    Rough stone steps lead down the pit.
1000    Rough stone steps lead up the dome.
8       black (sham) rock
0000    >$<
1000    >$<
9       wooden pole
0000    A wooden pole is lying nearby.
1000    A wooden pole has been stuck in the mud here.
10      coil of rope
0000    There is a tightly coiled rope here.
1000    As you play, the coiled rope begins to vibrate and sway.
2000    The rope is rising straight upwards!
3000    The rope is extended vertically right to the top of the well.
4000    As you clamber from the well, the rope suddenly collapses
4000    and disappears out of sight.
5000    As soon as you stop playing, the rope collapses back into a
5000    tight coil.
11      snake
0000    A huge green fierce snake bars the way!
1000    >$<  (Chased away)
12      fissure
0000    >$<
1000    A crystal bridge now spans the fissure.
2000    The crystal bridge has vanished!
13      drainpipe
0000    >$<         (RAVINE DRY).
1000    The ravine is filled with dark muddy water.
14      giant clam  >grunt!<
0000    There is an enormous clam here with its shell tightly closed.
15      giant oyster  >groan!<
0000    There is an enormous oyster here with its shell tightly closed.
1000    Interesting.  There seems to be something written on the underside of
1000    the oyster.
16      official document
0000    An official-looking document is lying nearby.
1000    Hidden inside the piano is an official-looking document.
18      helicopter
0000    Not far away is a helicopter.  Its engine is idling slowly.
1000    A helicopter is waiting nearby.
2000    A helicopter is waiting nearby.
19      knapsack
0000    There is a bulging knapsack here.
1000    >$<  (wearing knapsack)
20      pumps in mine
0000    >$<             (PUMPS SILENT).
1000    The deep hum of heavy machinery fills the control room.
2000    >$<             (PUMPS EXPLODED).
21      chasm - troll bridge
0000    A rickety wooden bridge extends across the chasm, vanishing into the
0000    mist.  A sign posted on the bridge reads, "Stop! Pay troll!"
1000    The wreckage of a bridge (and a dead bear) can be seen at the bottom
1000    of the chasm.
22      chasm2 & decrepit natural bridge
0000    A decrepit natural bridge spans the chasm.  A message scrawled into
0000    the rock wall reads: "Bridge out of repair.  Maximum load: 35 Foonts."
1000    The remnants of a natural bridge partially overhang the chasm.
23      mirror
0000    >$<
24      plant
0000    There is a tiny little plant in the pit, murmuring "Water, water, ..."
1000    The plant spurts into furious growth for a few seconds.
2000    There is a 12-foot-tall beanstalk stretching up out of the pit,
2000    bellowing "Water!! Water!!"
3000    The plant grows explosively, almost filling the bottom of the pit.
4000    There is a gigantic beanstalk stretching all the way up to the hole.
5000    You've over-watered the plant!  It's shriveling up!  It's, it's...
25      phony plant (seen in twopit room only when tall enough)
0000    >$<
1000    The top of a 12-foot-tall beanstalk is poking out of the west pit.
2000    There is a huge beanstalk growing out of the west pit up to the hole.
26      stalactite
0000    >$<
27      shadowy figure
0000    The shadowy figure seems to be trying to attract your attention.
28      dwarf's axe
0000    There is a little axe here.
1000    There is a little axe lying beside the bear.
2000    There is a little axe lying beside the Wumpus.
3000    There is a little axe lying beside the dog.
4000    Deeply entangled in the brambles is a little axe.
29      cave drawings
0000    >$<
30      pirate
0000    >$<
31      dragon
0000    A huge green fierce dragon bars the way!
1000    Congratulations!  You have just vanquished a dragon with your bare
1000    hands!  (Unbelievable, isn't it?)
2000    The body of a huge green dead dragon is lying off to one side.
32      briar pipe
0000    There is a small briar pipe here.
33      troll
0000    A burly troll stands by the bridge and insists you throw him a
0000    treasure before you may cross.
1000    The troll steps out from beneath the bridge and blocks your way.
2000    >$<  (Chased away)
34      phony troll
0000    The troll is nowhere to be seen.
41      rusty door
0000    The way north is barred by a massive, rusty, iron door.
1000    The way north leads through a massive, rusty, iron door.
42      tiny door
0000    The only way past the wall is through a tiny locked door.
1000    The only way past the wall is through a tiny open door.
43      tiny door
0000    The door is locked.
1000    The door is open.
44      phone booth door
0000    >$<
45      oaken door
0000    A massive door of solid oak guards the castle entrance.  In
0000    the center of the door is a small slot.
1000    >$<
46      steel door with inlaid tiles
0000    The stainless steel door is locked.
1000    The stainless steel door is unlocked.
47      door to secret garden
0000    A wooden door leads out to the garden.
1000    A wooden door leads into the castle.
48      wooden boat
0000    There is a small wooden boat here.
1000    You are in a small boat.
49      sticks at Styx
0000    >$<
50      large gold nugget
0000    There is a large sparkling nugget of gold here!
51      several diamonds
0000    There are diamonds here!
52      silver horn
0000    There is a silver horn here!
53      precious jewelry
0000    There is precious jewelry here!
1000    >$<  (wearing jewelry)
54      rare coins
0000    There are many coins here!
55      treasure chest
0000    The pirate's treasure chest is here!
56      golden eggs
0000    There is a large nest here, full of golden eggs!
1000    The nest of golden eggs has vanished!
2000    Done!
57      jeweled trident
0000    There is a jewel-encrusted trident here!
58      ming vase
0000    There is a delicate, precious, ming vase here!
1000    The vase is now resting, delicately, on a velvet pillow.
2000    The floor is littered with worthless shards of pottery.
3000    The ming vase drops with a delicate crash.
59      egg-sized emerald
0000    There is an emerald here the size of a plover's egg!
60      platinum pyramid
0000    There is a platinum pyramid here, 8 inches on a side!
61      glistening pearl
0000    Off to one side lies a glistening pearl!
62      persian rug
0000    There is a persian rug spread out on the floor!
1000    The dragon is sprawled out on a persian rug!!
63      rare spice
0000    There is some rare spice here!
64      buzzing sound
0000    A loud buzzing sound can be heard not far off.
65      gleaming sword
0000    There is a gleaming sword here!
1000    You grasp the sword's handle and give a mighty heave, but with a
1000    loud clang the sword blade shatters into several fragments.
2000    Rusty shards of an elven sword lie scattered about.
3000    A very clean sword is stuck into the anvil!
4000    An oily sword is stuck into the anvil.
66      elven crown
0000    An ancient crown of elven kings lies here!
1000    >$<  (wearing crown)
67      ruby slippers
0000    There is a pair of ruby slippers here.
1000    >$<  (wearing slippers)
2000    There is a pair of ruby slippers here.
68      delicate lyre
0000    There is a delicate lyre here!
69      star sapphire
0000    There is a star sapphire here!
70      Holy Grail
0000    There is an ornate silver chalice here!
71      oaken cask
0000    There is a cask of water here.
1000    There is an empty oaken cask here.
2000    There is a cask of oil here.
3000    >$<  (Unused)
4000    There is a cask of wine here.
72      golden ring
0000    There is a small gold ring here.
1000    >$<  (wearing ring)
2000    On the Wumpus' finger is a small gold ring.
73      shamrock
0000    There is a four-leafed clover here!
1000    >$<  (wearing clover)

1000    >$<  (Boat isn't on this shore.)

3000    making him veerrrrry hungry!

4000    on your neck!

171     giant centipede

1000    Provoked beyond endurance (centipedes have none), the indignant
1000    insect lurches to all of its feet and starts towards you.
2000    The cantankerous cootie is heading towards you, and he
2000    definitely harbors no goodwill towards you.
3000    The angry arthropod is definitely gaining on you.  You had
3000    better either sprout several more legs or find some way to
3000    evade him.
4000    The incensed insect is in full gear now.  If you don't move
4000    quickly, his monstrous mandibles may masticate you into murky mush!
5000    You are just too slow!  The baneful bug has caught up to you!
5000    The word "stomp" takes on a whole new meaning as you are kicked
5000    to death by a creature with 73 feet!
6000    You have raised the bridge just in time.  The centipede stamps
6000    furiously up and down in front of the moat, but, finding no
6000    way to cross, finally gives up and lumbers back to his cave.
